docs.text: My Story Chapter 1: 1 or 2 Many are probably familiar with the dullness of their work but nothing like the extential dread that struck him day after day. Clock in. Put a smile on. Clock out. Do it all over again. Survive. Time could not go any slower. The plain, boring, monotony of it. Which lens is better? These drops will do the trick. It takes a while to get used to your new prescription, Mr Smith. I should be grateful , he thought. Between the mental images of those who are starving and shivering from homelessness, he wondered how he got here. If there was such thing as a time machine, he wouldn't hesitate to go back. To save him, to save himself. The year was 1992. Nothing smelt better, even better than a perfected warm curry, than leaving a worn torn country for a land of oppourtunity, the land of the long white cloud, Aotearoa. That wasn't his success story. His journey started a year later. Born to Sri Lankan Tamil immigrants. Born in the year of 1993, son to Sri Lankan Tamil immigrants, nothing smelt better, even better than a perfected warm curry, than leaving a worn torn country for a land of oppourtunity. The land of the long white cloud, Aotearoa.
